item.title: Inferring The Type of A Numeric Literal - The Algorithm.
item.description: Inferring The Type of A Numeric Literal A value written in a numeric literal always represents a specific type, which is determined by the literal itself. The type of a literal can be one of the basic types, such as int, float, or decimal. For example, the literal 10 represents the integer value 10, and its basic type is int. However, in some contexts, the same literal 10 can also represent a floating-point value 10.
